Class GitCommandCenterScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GitCommandCenterScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class GitCommandCenterScreen
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Assembles a center for users to perform Git commands of push, pull, diff, and clone.
    Author:
    April Miller, Griffin White
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GitCommandCenterScreen

        public GitCommandCenterScreen​(int width,
                              int height,
                              java.awt.Color bgColor,
                              FrameManager frameManager)
        Creates a new GitCommandCenterScreen panel which serves as a center for the user to perform Git commands of push, pull, diff, and clone.
        Parameters:
        width - - the width of the panel.
        height - - the height of the panel.
        bgColor - - the background color of the panel.
        frameManager - - the frameManager which the panel will reference in order to swap panels.

    • Method Detail

      • cancelPushTimer

        private void cancelPushTimer()
        Cancels or stops the existing pushTimer and pushTask. Once canceled, a new Timer and TimerTask must be created with method resumeTimer().

      • resumePushTimer

        private void resumePushTimer()
        Resumes the pushTimer and pushTask by creating new instances of each. The pushTask will call frameManager.git.githubPush and the pushTimer will perform that task every 30 seconds.

      • updateUITheme

        public void updateUITheme​(boolean isDarkMode)
        Updates the aesthetics of the current panel based on whether it is light or dark mode NOTE: does not update isDarkMode in frame manager
        Parameters:
        isDarkMode - - if this is set to dark mode or not

      • enableButtons

        private void enableButtons()
        Enable or disable buttons based on the features allowed for the current userType and update tooltips for buttons accordingly. Students have pull and diff permissions. Professors have push permissions. Clone has clone permissions.

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Called every time repaint() is called, used to update UI Theme from FrameManager (non-Javadoc)
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        See Also:
        JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)
